alert.note: Alert for Clarendon; Southeastern Orangeburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 29 at 4:50PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Clarendon and east central Orangeburg Counties through 530 PM EDT... At 450 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Eastern Lake Marion, or 15 miles south of Manning, moving west at 10 mph. ...Boaters on Lake Marion Should Seek Safe Harbor... HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Summerton, Eutawville, Rocks Pond Campground and Marina, Blounts Landing, Eautaw Springs and Indian Bluff Recreation Park. This includes Interstate 95 between mile markers 108 and 110. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
